frameDefinitions: A Cognizer retains facts in memory and is able to retrieve them.
The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path.
An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances.
An Agent causes a Hidden_object to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a Hiding_place or putting in place an Obstruction that screens the object.
A Theme moves with respect to a Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape.
A Cognizer thinks of and performs an Action that is a self- or other-imposed task or some other kind of desirable behavior.
frameExamples: I was impressed that she 'd actually <t>remembered</t> Radish 's name (= what Radish's name is)
She <t>walked</t> along the road for a while.
Mike <t>avoided</t> his supervisor at all costs.
Therefore, as I passed the school, I <t>hid</t> the gun and holster in the mailbox
You invited everybody but you <t>forgot</t> Harry.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who retains and retrieves information.
<fen>Mental_content</fen> stored by and accessible to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. It may derive from experience or activity or simply from being informed of it.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> retrieves <fen>Mental_content</fen> or forgets it.
<fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.

<fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.  This includes 'middle of path'' expressions.
<fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

<fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.  Note that this role should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the <fen>Place</fen> FE.
The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion.
The time when the motion occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>.  This role can be differentiated from <fen>Area</fen> by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets.
The <fen>Agent</fen> avoids an <fen>Undesirable_situation</fen>.
This role identifies the situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> avoids.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the avoiding occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the avoiding occurs.
The <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is the entity which is blocked from view.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who causes the Hidden_entity to be not perceptually accessible to potential perceivers.
The location in which the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is placed so as not to be perceptually accessible.
<fen>Time</fen> denotes the interval of time during which the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> to become hidden from perceptual access.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the spatial setting in which the hiding event takes place.
A physical entity that is participating in non-translational motion.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> is in bounded motion.
The location where the bounded motion happens.
The person who thinks of or fails to think of an obligatory or desireable <fen>Action</fen>.
An <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is supposed to carry out. This may be a Task imposed specifically on the <fen>Cognizer</fen> or it may be self- or socially imposed.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is a person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> needs to affect or effect when carrying out the <fen>Action</fen>.
A <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers or fails to carry out an <fen>Action</fen>.
listRoleExamples: I bet <fex>Johno</fex> can remember the name of the Ramones' drummer.
Do you remember <fex>how to spell cupboard ?</fex>
<fex>Afterwards</fex>, I forgot what I was pissed off about, but I was.
The cat ran <fex>out of the house</fex>.
You should walk <fex>south</fex> about a block .
The hitchhikers walked <fex>in the middle of the road</fex>.
<fex>Mike</fex> avoided his supervisor at all costs.
Mike avoided <fex>his supervisor</fex> at all costs.

Michael Jackson gave wine to the 13-year-old cancer patient at the center of
the molestation charges he's battling but concealed <fex>it</fex> inside a Coke can.
<fex>The deputy</fex> concealed the bayonet under his coat.
He had concealed the necklace <fex>behind him</fex>.
.<fex>Alex and Zach Swindle</fex>, Centre, visited their brother in San Francisco in June and remembered to take along a copy of The Post>.
This time we remembered <fex>to turn the gas off before leaving</fex>.
We piled into the taxi and right when we were about to leave, I realized we forgot <fex>the video camera</fex>
He remembered <fex>afterwards</fex> to kiss her fingers.
